summary: This is the U.S. Government's response to a petition by Jane Does #1 and #2 requesting production of the Non-Prosecution Agreement with Jeffrey Epstein and a Report of Interview with Jane Doe #1. The Government refuses to voluntarily produce the agreement due to a confidentiality clause and states no formal interview report was prepared after a meeting with Jane Doe #1 in September 2007.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure who entered into a non-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Government, which petitioners are seeking to obtain.

persons.name: Jane Doe #1
persons.context: One of the petitioners seeking the non-prosecution agreement; met with FBI Special Agents in September 2007 to discuss the agreement.

persons.name: Jane Doe #2
persons.context: One of the petitioners (along with Jane Doe #1) seeking the non-prosecution agreement.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney who submitted this government response through an assistant.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Listed on the service list as counsel for Jane Does #1 and #2.

connections.description: Implied by the context of the petition and the non-prosecution agreement related to Epstein's conduct.

events.title: FBI Meeting with Jane Doe #1
events.description: FBI Special Agents met with Jane Doe #1 in late September 2007 to discuss the Non-Prosecution Agreement entered into with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Government Files Response to Petition
events.description: The U.S. Government filed this response refusing to voluntarily produce the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement and stating no formal interview report was created after the September 2007 meeting.

locations: United States District Court, Southern District of Florida
keyFacts: The U.S. Government refused to voluntarily produce the Non-Prosecution Agreement with Jeffrey Epstein due to a clause anticipating the agreement would not be made part of any public record.
No formal Report of Interview was prepared after FBI Special Agents met with Jane Doe #1 in late September 2007 to discuss the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement.
The document reveals efforts by victims (Jane Does #1 and #2) to obtain the non-prosecution agreement through legal petition in 2008.
R. Alexander Acosta was the U.S. Attorney overseeing this response regarding the Epstein non-prosecution agreement.
The case number (08-80736-CIV-MARRA/JOHNSON) indicates this was an active civil proceeding in the Southern District of Florida in 2008.
